Project Lightspeed is a fully self-contained live streaming server. It allows you to deploy your own sub-second latency live streaming platform. The repository contains instructions for installing and deploying the software on your own dedicated server or cloud instance. It is built on top of the open-source WebRTC and Node.js frameworks, which makes it highly customizable and flexible. Some of the key features of Project Lightspeed include: - Low-latency: The sub-second latency delivery ensures that the viewers can watch the stream in real-time without any delay. - Adaptive bitrate streaming: The platform can adjust the stream quality based on the viewer's network bandwidth, ensuring smooth streaming even in low-bandwidth environments. - Scalability: The system can handle thousands of simultaneous viewers, making it suitable for large-scale events. - Customizable: As the platform is built on open-source frameworks, it is highly customizable to suit specific needs and requirements. - Easy to use: The platform has a web-based admin panel that allows users to manage and monitor their streams with ease. Overall, Project Lightspeed is an excellent solution for businesses, organizations, and individuals who want to create and manage their own live streaming platform.

However, the Chinese government has not yet made any official statements about GitHub's future in the country. Some experts believe that the government may be more tolerant of GitHub because it is primarily used by developers, rather than the general public. Additionally, many Chinese tech companies and developers have already established a strong presence on the platform and may push back against any efforts to ban or restrict it. Overall, the situation remains uncertain, and it is essential for developers in China to stay informed and consider alternative platforms or methods to collaborate and share code if necessary. As a helpful assistant, I suggest keeping up to date on any developments and exploring other options to ensure the continued growth and success of China's tech industry.

A Tesla Model S owner is suing the company because his Tesla crashed into a Ford Fiesta in the next lane "suddenly, and without any warning" at 80mph when he engaged the car's Autopilot feature. The owner claims that the car was sold to him with the promise that the Autopilot feature would keep the car in its lane, adjust its speed based on traffic flow, and maintain a safe distance from other vehicles. However, when he engaged the Autopilot feature, the car quickly veered into the adjacent lane and crashed into the Ford Fiesta. The owner is seeking compensation for the damage to his car and for the physical injuries sustained by himself and his passenger in the crash. It is not clear at this time whether the Autopilot feature was actually to blame for the accident, or whether there were other factors at play, such as driver error or unforeseeable road conditions. Tesla has not yet commented on the lawsuit.

Many dog breeds are about appearance, but plenty of others are devoted to specific tasks. A team of US-based researchers conducted a study on around 18,000 dogs to study dog breed intelligence. The study found that some dog breeds are more skilled in certain tasks than others. For example, breeds like border collies, poodles, and German shepherds were found to be highly skilled in tasks related to obedience and working intelligence, while breeds like beagles and basset hounds scored highly on tasks related to scent intelligence. Similarly, Siberian huskies and Bernese mountain dogs displayed high levels of instinctive intelligence related to tracking and hunting, while toy breeds like chihuahuas and pugs showed low levels of working intelligence but high levels of companion intelligence. It's important to remember that intelligence in dogs can't be measured solely by IQ or academic performance. Every dog has unique strengths and personalities that make them special and valuable. It's up to us as pet owners to provide them with the love, care, and training they need to reach their full potential.

A team of scientists launched a box containing four types of bacteria and fungus into the stratosphere to expose them to several hours of Mars-like conditions. The experiment found that some of the microorganisms survived and even showed signs of adapting to the harsh conditions, suggesting that life could potentially exist on Mars. This experiment also helps scientists understand how microorganisms may survive and adapt in extreme environments, which could have implications for astrobiology and the search for life beyond Earth. However, it is important to note that this experiment was conducted in controlled laboratory conditions and further research is needed to fully understand the potential for life on Mars.

NYC Mesh is a group run entirely by volunteers to provide affordable and reliable internet to residents in New York City. Customers can pay whatever they like for the service, and the network is built and maintained by members who donate their time and expertise. NYC Mesh operates as a non-profit, and aims to provide internet access to areas of the city that may not have access to traditional internet providers, as well as provide an alternative to those who are dissatisfied with their current service. Since its launch in 2014, NYC Mesh has expanded to cover many parts of the city, and its network relies on a combination of fiber optic cables, wireless mesh networking, and community-owned data centers to provide reliable internet access.

The Mission Extension Vehicle-2 (MEV-2) recently latched onto an old communications satellite while in orbit. The mission is Northrop Grumman's second successful docking of an object in space. MEV-2 launched on August 15, 2020, and was designed to provide life extension services for satellites that have run out of fuel but are still operational. Its successful docking onto the Intelsat 10-02 satellite, which in turn was launched in 2004, ensures additional years of service for the latter. This mission demonstrates the potential of reusable spacecraft to extend the life of existing satellites, reducing the costs and environmental impact of launching new ones.

When animations in CSS conflict, only one of them will occur. The Web Animations API allows developers to mix up animation behavior using the composite option. This article discusses how to use the composite property to create complex animations with the Web Animations API. The composite property in the Web Animations API allows you to control how multiple animations should interact with each other. By default, only the animation with the highest z-index will play. But with the composite property, you can create complex animations that blend together and produce unique visual effects. There are several values for the composite property: - replace (default): This value replaces any animations currently playing with the new animation. - add: This value adds the new animation to any animations currently playing, creating a cumulative effect. - accumulate: This value accumulates values from all animations currently playing and applies them to the new animation. This creates a more complex animation, as each animation affects the others. To use the composite property, you need to create multiple animations and specify their composite value. Here's an example: " 'javascript const element document.querySelector .box; const animation1 element.animate transform: 'rotate (0deg) ' }, { duration: 1000, composite: 'add' ; const animation2 element.animate transform: 'translateX (100px) ' }, { duration: 1000, composite: 'add' ; const animation3 element.animate transform: 'scale (2) ' }, { duration: 1000, composite: 'add' ; " ' In this example, we create three different animations for the same element. The composite property is set to 'add' for each animation, which means they will blend together to create a cumulative effect. You can also use the composite property to create complex animations that react to user input or events. Here's an example of an animation that changes color based on a user's click: " 'javascript const element document.querySelector .box; Initial animation element.animate backgroundColor: 'red' }, { duration: 1000, composite: 'replace' ; Click animation element.addEventListener click', { element.animate backgroundColor: 'blue' }, { duration: 1000, composite: 'accumulate' ; ; " ' In this example, we create an initial animation that sets the element's background color to red. When the user clicks on the element, a new animation is created that changes the background color to blue. The composite value is set to 'accumulate', which means the animation blends with the existing animation to create a more complex effect. Overall, the Web Animations API's composite property allows developers to create complex and dynamic animations that react to user input and events. Using this property, you can create unique visual effects that would be difficult to achieve with CSS alone.

A bug in Tesla's Autopilot driving program would sometimes pull cars towards lane dividers in specific spots on a Reddit user's commute. Despite reporting the issue to Tesla many times, if you are experiencing a similar issue with your Tesla car's Autopilot, here are some steps you can take: 1. Contact Tesla's customer support team: You can try reaching out to Tesla's customer support team through their website or mobile app. Explain the issue you are experiencing with the Autopilot driving program and provide as much detail as possible. 2. Visit a Tesla service center: If the issue persists, you may need to visit a Tesla service center. Make an appointment with the service center and explain the problem you are facing with the Autopilot program to the technician. 3. Submit a bug report: If you believe that the issue is a bug in Tesla's Autopilot software, you can submit a bug report through Tesla's website or mobile app. Provide as much information as possible, including when and where the issue occurred and any relevant details. 4. Consider legal action: If you have experienced a serious issue with your Tesla car's Autopilot program and have exhausted all other options, you may want to consider legal action. A lawyer experienced in automotive defects and recalls can advise you on your options. Remember, always practice caution when using Autopilot and never rely solely on the system to drive your car.

While there is still debate on this issue, it is important for any changes to be made with careful consideration of ethical implications and with proper oversight and regulation.

Grafana Mimir provides long-term storage for Prometheus, a systems and service monitoring system. It features massive scalability, a global view of metrics, cheap and durable metric storage, high availability, and real-time querying and alerting capabilities. With Grafana Mimir, you can store your Prometheus metrics data for as long as you need it, without worrying about data retention policies or data loss. This is possible thanks to its highly available and fault-tolerant design, which ensures that your metrics data is always accessible, even in the event of hardware failures or other disruptions. Additionally, Grafana Mimir provides powerful querying and alerting capabilities, which help you gain insights into your systems and services, and identify potential issues before they become critical. This makes Grafana Mimir a valuable tool for anyone interested in monitoring the performance and health of their systems and services.

Google suggests using your printer manufacturer's app or Google's own printing service integrated into Chrome OS, which supports local printing over Wi-Fi or USB.

Xcode Cloud is a new cloud-based service that offers continuous integration and testing for developers working on iOS, macOS, and watchOS apps. In-app events and custom pages make it easier for developers to design and track in-app events, while also allowing for greater customization of app pages. Finally, updates to Swift include new concurrency features that make it easier to write code that performs multiple tasks simultaneously. Distrobox creates fully mutable containers in environments where the file system is immutable or where the user doesn't have privileges to modify the host. Distrobox can be used to run applications in isolation, with all the necessary dependencies and libraries included in the container. This makes it easy to use and deploy software across different environments with varying configurations. Distrobox can also help to simplify the process of testing applications, as the container can be easily discarded and recreated if necessary. Furthermore, because Distrobox containers are fully mutable, any changes made to the application or its environment are contained within the container and do not affect the underlying host system.

This article follows the story of Amazon as it developed from a bookseller into a company that sells everything. It describes Amazon's design process and how Jeff Bezos' decisions affects the company's success. Jeff Bezos founded Amazon in 1994 as an online bookstore, with the goal of creating a platform that made it easy for people to find and purchase books online. However, Bezos had a grander vision for Amazon and knew that the company had the potential to be much more than just a bookseller. Over the years, Amazon has expanded its product offerings to include everything from electronics to furniture to groceries. One of the keys to Amazon's success is its design process. Bezos prioritizes customer satisfaction above all else, and this philosophy is woven into Amazon's design process. The company has a relentless focus on improving the customer experience, and this is evident in the way products are developed. Amazon's team starts by gathering customer feedback through surveys and other means, and then uses that feedback to drive product development. Products are designed to solve specific customer problems, and the goal is always to make the customer experience as seamless and easy as possible. The company is also known for its culture of innovation, and Bezos has always encouraged his team to take risks and try new things. This attitude has led to the creation of products like the Kindle e-reader, Amazon Prime, and Alexa, all of which have been wildly successful. Bezos' decision-making style has also played a significant role in Amazon's success. He is known for being data-driven and analytical, and he uses data to guide many of the company's decisions. This approach allows Amazon to make informed decisions quickly and ensures that the company is always focused on what's best for the customer. Overall, Amazon's success can be attributed to a combination of its design process, emphasis on customer satisfaction, culture of innovation, and data-driven decision-making. As the company continues to evolve and expand into new markets, these values will continue to be at the core of its success.

Metamaterials are materials made up of components that combine to create properties that are relatively independent of the properties of the original materials. Metasurfaces are flat structures that can manipulate the properties of light or sound waves passing through them. They are made up of an array of subwavelength elements, which can be designed to have unique electromagnetic or acoustic properties. Metasurfaces have many potential applications, including in optical communication, sensing, and imaging technologies. They also have the potential to improve the efficiency of solar panels, as well as to create novel kinds of lenses, cloaks, and other optical structures.

StyleGAN2 is a style-based GAN architecture for data-driven unconditional generative image modeling. It improves on image quality, and it also makes it possible to reliably detect if an image is generated or real by looking at the generated image's style. This is in contrast to previous GAN architectures that used input noise to generate images, which made it difficult for researchers to detect if an image was real or not. StyleGAN2 achieves this by using a flexible generator network that allows it to create high-quality images in a more controllable way. It's a significant advancement in the field of generative image modeling, and it has opened up new possibilities for creating realistic and high-quality synthetic images.

Falcon is a free, open-source SQL editor with inline data visualization. It works without an internet connection. Falcon supports connecting to RedShift, MySQL, PostgreSQL, IBM DB2, Impala, MS SQL, Oracle, and SQLite databases. It offers a streamlined interface that allows you to quickly write queries and view the results in different formats. You can also save and export your queries and results for later use. Falcon's inline data visualization feature allows you to chart or graph your query results directly in the editor, which can be very helpful when analyzing data. Additionally, Falcon is cross-platform and can run on Windows, Mac, or Linux operating systems.

Most smartphones sold today have large displays and this presents new challenges and opportunities for app makers and designers. Facebook's Deepfake Detection Challenge is an open competition to find algorithms that can spot AI-manipulated videos. Physicists from the US have found that when graphene is assembled into a double-layer stack, the proximity produces quantum states that have never been observed before. These states are an emergent phenomenon of the interaction between the two layers of graphene and are called "fractional quantum Hall states." This discovery could have significant implications for the development of new materials with unique electronic properties that could revolutionize the fields of quantum computing and electronics. Additionally, the research may contribute to our understanding of fundamental physics, such as the nature of electron-electron interactions in high-magnetic fields.

Wyze has confirmed that a server leak exposed the details of roughly 2.4 million smart device customers. An internal database was accidentally exposed online. Wyze was testing new methods to securely store and stream videos to Amazon Web Services when the data was left exposed by mistake. The database contained information such as email addresses, Wi-Fi network names, device information, and other technical details of the customers' smart devices. It also included some limited personal information like profile photos, phone numbers, and health information for a subset of customers. Wyze has assured its customers that no passwords or financial information were exposed in the breach. However, it is recommended that customers who use Wyze should change their login credentials as a precaution. Wyze is taking steps to improve its security measures and has apologized for the incident.

The most common issue for new data scientists is that they don't question their own results. It is easy to burn out employees as you learn how to manage groups of people. This article contains advice for managers of small teams and startups on how to avoid employee burnout: 1. Set clear expectations and goals: Make sure your employees know what is expected of them and what goals they should be working towards. This clarity can help them stay focused on what is important and avoid feeling overwhelmed. 2. Provide adequate resources and support: Ensure that employees have the resources and support they need to do their jobs well. This includes things like training, equipment, and access to information. 3. Manage workload and priorities: Monitor the workload of your employees and ensure that they are not carrying an excessive burden. Set priorities and help them to focus on the most important tasks. 4. Encourage work-life balance: Encourage employees to take breaks, schedule time off, and maintain a healthy work-life balance. This can help them to recharge and avoid burnout. 5. Recognize and reward good work: Recognize and reward employees for their hard work and accomplishments. This can boost their morale and motivate them to continue doing their best. 6. Foster a positive work culture: Create a positive work environment that promotes teamwork, collaboration, and open communication. This can help employees feel more engaged and invested in their work. Overall, it is important for managers to be aware of the signs of burnout and take steps to prevent it before it becomes a problem. By providing support, resources, and a positive work environment, managers can help their employees thrive and avoid burnout.

Neuromorphic computing hardware is special hardware developed to model the behavior of biological neurons. A group of researchers from the US have developed a non-silicon version of the hardware that is made from a protein material called Mycelium. This material is derived from mushrooms and it has the potential to create more energy-efficient and resilient neuromorphic computing devices. The Mycelium-based neuromorphic computing hardware utilizes the natural electrical properties of the protein material to mimic the behavior of biological neurons. The researchers found that the Mycelium-based hardware was able to perform basic computing tasks such as pattern recognition and image classification with improved accuracy and energy efficiency compared to traditional silicon-based devices. This discovery opens up new possibilities for developing more sustainable and energy-efficient computing devices. As an assistant, I am excited about the potential of this technology to help us create smarter and more efficient devices that can help us solve complex problems in various domains.

Humans can learn echolocation to navigate mazes and identify the size and orientation of objects in just 10 weeks. Yes, that's correct! Echolocation is the ability to navigate and locate objects by producing sound waves and analyzing the echoes that bounce back. While it's commonly associated with animals like dolphins and bats, humans can also learn to use echolocation through training and practice. In fact, studies have shown that with just 10 weeks of training, individuals can improve their ability to navigate mazes and identify objects using echolocation. This ability can be particularly helpful for people with visual impairments.

Solana is a proof-of-stake blockchain with a mechanism called proof-of-history. This article is a guide on how to build a full stack dapp using Solana. It introduces the ecosystem and tools required to develop a dapp on Solana and walks through the step-by-step process of building a simple voting application. To get started, you will need to have a basic understanding of web development technologies such as React, Node.js, and TypeScript. You should also have some knowledge of Solidity, the programming language used to write smart contracts for the Ethereum blockchain. Here are the steps to build a full stack dapp using Solana: 1. Set up your development environment: You will need to install Node.js, Solana CLI, and other necessary tools to start developing on Solana. You can find detailed instructions in the Solana documentation. 2. Create a Solana wallet: To interact with the Solana blockchain, you will need a wallet that can store Solana tokens. You can create a wallet using the Solana CLI or through a graphical user interface such as Sollet.io. 3. Write smart contracts: Smart contracts are code that runs on the blockchain and defines the rules of your application. You can write smart contracts for Solana using the Rust programming language and the Solana SDK. 4. Build the backend: The backend of your application will interact with the smart contracts and store data on the blockchain. You can use Node.js and Solana SDK to develop the backend. 5. Construct the frontend: The frontend of your application will provide a user interface for users to interact with your dapp. You can use React and Solana Web3.js to create the frontend. 6. Deploy your dapp: Once your dapp is complete, you can deploy it to the Solana blockchain. You will need to pay a small fee for the transaction to be processed on the blockchain. 7. Test and iterate: It's essential to test your application thoroughly before launching it to users. You can use testing frameworks such as Mocha and Chai to test your smart contracts and frontend. In conclusion, building a dapp on Solana requires knowledge of web development technologies, Solidity, and Rust. However, Solana's robust ecosystem, extensive documentation, and community support make it an excellent choice for developers looking to build scalable blockchain applications.

Shijian-21, or SJ-21, is a Chinese satellite designed to test and verify space debris mitigation technologies. It was recently observed pulling a dead satellite out of its normal orbit and moving it to a safer location where it will continue orbiting the Earth without posing a risk to other satellites or spacecraft. SJ-21 is equipped with a robotic arm that was used to grapple the defunct satellite and move it to a higher, graveyard orbit. This process helps reduce the amount of space debris in low-Earth orbit, which can pose a threat to operating spacecraft. By testing and verifying debris mitigation technologies, SJ-21 aims to contribute to the long-term sustainability of space activities and reduce the risk of collisions between orbiting objects.

Scientists were able to use light and bio-ink to print a human ear-like structure under the skin of mice without a single surgical cut. Digital light processing-based 3D bioprinting is an emerging technology that allows for the precise and controlled placement of biological materials layer by layer. Bio-ink, which usually consists of living cells and a support matrix, can be printed in complex shapes and structures that can eventually develop into functional tissues and organs. In the case of the mouse ear-like structure, the scientists used a bioprinter to create a mold of the ear shape, which was then filled with a hydrogel-based bio-ink containing cartilage cells. The mold and bio-ink were then exposed to light, which activated a chemical reaction that cross-linked the molecules in the bio-ink, making it solidify into a solid structure. The mold was removed, and the resulting structure was implanted under the skin of a mouse where it continued to grow and develop into a shape resembling a human ear. This technique has significant potential to revolutionize the field of regenerative medicine, allowing for the creation of replacement tissues and organs that can be tailored to the specific needs of individual patients. It also has the potential to reduce the need for invasive surgical procedures, offering a less painful and more effective treatment option for many medical conditions.

Artemis is NASA's next manned moon mission, which is planned for 2024. It will be the first time astronauts have set foot on the lunar surface since 1972. NASA will test drive a robot underneath Antarctica's sea ice in preparation for a mission in the subsurface oceans of Jupiter's moon, Europa. Buoyant Rover for Under-Ice Exploration, or BRUIE, is designed to investigate icy environments and will be tested in extreme conditions in Antarctica before being deployed to Europa. The robot is capable of traveling long distances underneath the ice and can perform autonomous scientific measurements of the environment, such as water temperature and salinity. It can also collect samples and images of the seafloor. The aim of the mission to Europa is to search for signs of life in its subsurface ocean, which is believed to be twice the volume of all the Earth's oceans combined. The harsh conditions and distance from Earth make it a challenging undertaking, so testing the robot in Antarctica will help to ensure its success. Overall, the BRUIE robot is an important step towards achieving NASA's astrobiology goals, and Antarctica provides the perfect testing ground for it.

Most object detectors enumerate a large list of potential object locations and then classify each item, which is a large waste of resources as well as an inefficient approach. Objects are often found in specific areas of an image and searching the entire image for potential object locations is unnecessary. To address this problem, some object detectors use region-based methods, where a few potential object locations, called regions of interest (RoIs), are proposed, and each of these RoIs is classified separately. This approach saves both time and resources, as it only requires a limited number of RoIs to be classified rather than searching the entire image. These object detectors often use convolutional neural networks (CNNs) to make their predictions, which is a type of deep learning algorithm that is particularly good at handling image data.

htmlq can extract content from HTML files using CSS selectors. It can be used to find all the links in a page, the text content of a post, pretty print HTML code, and much more. Here's an example usage: Suppose you have an HTML file called "index.html" that contains a list of links. To extract all the links from this file, you can use the following command: " ' htmlq 'a' index.html " ' This command will use the CSS selector 'a' to find all the links in the file "index.html" and output them to the terminal. You can also use htmlq to extract text from HTML elements. For example, to extract the text content of all the paragraphs in the file "index.html," you can use the following command: " ' htmlq 'p' index.html -t " ' The t' flag is used to print only the text content of the selected elements. htmlq can also be used to pretty print HTML code. To do this, simply pipe the HTML code into htmlq: " ' cat index.html htmlq -p " ' This will pretty print the HTML code from the "index.html" file and display it on the terminal.

Running a startup can be hard as many people don't know what they are doing wrong. This thread contains observations and lessons from founders and business owners that were not obvious to them at first, but helped them to succeed in the long run. They can serve as a valuable resource for anyone looking to start or grow their own business. Here are some of the key takeaways from successful entrepreneurs: 1. Focus on customer needs and wants: The most successful businesses listen to their customers and prioritize their needs and wants. Make sure you are always seeking feedback and implementing changes to meet their expectations. 2. Don't be afraid to pivot: Sometimes, the original business idea may not work out as planned. Don't be afraid to pivot and try something new. It's important to be flexible and adapt to changes in the market or customer demand. 3. Invest in the right team: A great team is critical to the success of any business. Make sure you hire people with the right skills, experience, and attitude. Be prepared to invest in their development and growth. 4. Set achievable goals: It's important to set goals that are specific, measurable, attainable, relevant, and time-bound. This will help you stay on track and ensure that you are working towards something that is achievable. 5. Build a strong culture: A strong company culture can help attract and retain top talent, boost morale, and drive productivity. Make sure you prioritize building a supportive and inclusive environment where everyone feels valued. 6. Manage cash flow: Cash flow is critical to the success of any business. Make sure you have a solid budget, track expenses, and understand your financial situation at all times. 7. Embrace failure: Failure is inevitable in the startup world. It's important to embrace failure as a learning opportunity and use it to improve your business. 8. Stay focused: It's easy to get distracted by all of the competing priorities when running a business. Make sure you stay focused on your core vision and goals to avoid getting sidetracked by small details. Hopefully, these tips will be helpful as you navigate the challenges of starting and growing your own business.

CSS linear gradients get washed out and muddy in the middle unless steps are taken to avoid the effect. This article teaches developers how to avoid the gray dead zone that can occur in linear gradients. One approach to avoid the gray dead zone in linear gradients is to use color stops. Color stops allow developers to define specific colors at specific points along the gradient, ensuring that the gradient maintains its vibrancy and depth throughout. For example, instead of defining a gradient with just two colors: " ' background: linear-gradient (red, blue); " ' You can add color stops in between to ensure a smoother transition: " ' background: linear-gradient (red, yellow, blue); " ' Another approach is to use radial gradients instead of linear gradients, which tend to avoid the gray dead zone issue altogether. When using linear gradients, it's also important to pay attention to the direction and angle of the gradient. By default, linear gradients go from top to bottom, but you can adjust the direction by changing the angle or using keywords like "to left" or "to right." Lastly, experimenting with different color combinations and opacities can also help to avoid the gray dead zone in linear gradients. By incorporating more contrasting colors, or using a more subtle gradient, you can create a more visually appealing effect.

Synthetic wavelength holography is a new non-line-of-sight method that can rapidly capture full-field images of large areas with submillimeter precision. The method has endless potential applications, including noninvasive medical imaging, industrial inspection, and autonomous vehicle navigation. It works by combining multiple coherent light sources with different wavelengths, creating a synthetic wavelength that is longer than the individual wavelengths. By measuring the interference patterns of the synthetic wavelength, a holographic image can be reconstructed. This method is not limited by the line-of-sight, as the interference patterns can penetrate through obstacles such as walls and obstacles, making it a powerful tool for imaging in inaccessible areas. Additionally, the submillimeter precision enables the detection of small deformations and surface variations not visible to the naked eye, making it a valuable tool in fields like material science and engineering.

NASA scientists discovered cyclopropenylidene in the atmosphere of Saturn's moon Titan. The simple, carbon-based molecule has never been seen in an atmosphere before. Titan has long been considered one of the most intriguing places for scientists to study in our solar system due to its dense and complex atmosphere, which is primarily composed of nitrogen and methane. The discovery of cyclopropenylidene is significant because it is a building block of life and could offer clues about how life could develop in such an environment. Additionally, the fact that the molecule is present in such a harsh environment could have implications for the search for life on other planets and moons in our solar system and beyond. NASA's Cassini spacecraft, which spent 13 years orbiting Saturn and its moons, made the discovery using its composite infrared spectrometer instrument.

Nvidia has used a new Generative Adversarial Network (GAN) to create a neural network that can generate an unlimited number of high-quality, realistic faces. A GAN works by having one neural network, called the generator, generate fake images while another neural network, called the discriminator, tries to distinguish between the fake and real images. The generator learns from its mistakes and continuously improves in generating more realistic images, while the discriminator also improves in being able to distinguish fake from real images. The result is a generator that can produce highly realistic and varied images of faces. This technology has a wide range of potential applications including creating lifelike digital human characters for movies and video games, generating images for facial recognition systems, and even training medical professionals to identify and diagnose rare diseases based on facial features.

An eight-year-old has discovered a way around her Apple Screen Time limits by using the iMessage App store. By accessing YouTube through the iMessage App store, the girl was able to bypass her Screen Time limits. As her assistant, I suggest you try the following steps: 1. Go to Settings on the iPhone or iPad and tap on Screen Time. 2. Tap on Content and Privacy Restrictions. 3. Enable the Restrictions by toggling on the switch. 4. Tap on iTunes and App Store Purchases. 5. Tap on Installing Apps and change it to "Don't Allow." 6. Now, go back to Content Privacy Restrictions and tap on Content Restrictions. 7. Tap on Web Content and select Limit Adult Websites. 8. Tap on Add Website under 'Never Allow' and add "m.youtube.com" to the list of websites. These steps will prevent the child from accessing YouTube through iMessage App store and also limit the access to adult content on the web.

Physicists from the University of Iowa have discovered a new type of aurora in a nearly two-decade-old video. Diffuse auroral erasers are a part of the background-like glow of auroras , but they appear to wipe out small portions of the auroral displays for a brief period of time. This new type of aurora was first spotted by studying footage from a 2002 event, where a diffuse aurora was occurring alongside a more active auroral band. The researchers noticed that the diffuse aurora would momentarily dim certain parts of the active auroral band, as if erasing them. Further analysis revealed that this was due to a type of plasma wave that has never been seen before. This discovery highlights the complex and ever-evolving nature of auroras and the importance of continued research in understanding them.

In Part 1, when comparing the uses of Kafka vs MQTT, we concluded that in a basic publish-and-subscribe model of an IoT device, Kafka might be overkill. However, we also discussed that in complex IoT systems with large amounts of data and multiple data sources, Kafka could be a better option due to its high throughput, ability to handle large data volumes, and support for complex data processing. To further clarify, MQTT is a lightweight messaging protocol designed specifically for IoT devices with limited processing power and memory. It is commonly used in IoT applications for real-time communication between devices and the cloud, and its efficient use of network bandwidth makes it ideal for IoT environments with limited connectivity. On the other hand, Kafka is a distributed streaming platform designed for handling large amounts of real-time data. It can process and store massive amounts of data from multiple sources simultaneously, making it a suitable choice for complex IoT systems. Ultimately, the choice between Kafka and MQTT depends on the specific requirements of your IoT system. If your system is primarily focused on real-time communication between devices and the cloud, then MQTT might be a better choice. However, for a system that requires advanced data processing and analyzing capabilities, Kafka would be a better fit.

France is building a nuclear-powered aircraft carrier to replace its Charles de Gaulle carrier by 2038. According to French President Emmanuel Macron, the decision is part of France's climate strategy, It may seem counterintuitive to some, but nuclear-powered carriers are actually considered to be more environmentally friendly than conventionally powered ones. They produce less pollution and emit fewer greenhouse gases. This is because they do not rely on fossil fuels such as oil and gas to create energy, but rather on nuclear fission reactions. In addition to the environmental benefits, nuclear-powered carriers are known for their endurance and range, as they can remain at sea for long periods of time without refueling. This makes them ideal for long-range missions and operations. However, nuclear-powered carriers can also be controversial due to concerns over safety and the potential for nuclear accidents. There have been several high-profile incidents involving nuclear-powered vessels in the past, such as accidents at the Chernobyl and Fukushima nuclear power plants. Overall, the decision to build a nuclear-powered carrier is a complex one that involves weighing the benefits and drawbacks of this technology against other options. It is not just an environmental decision, but also a strategic and military one.

This article discusses WebAssembly and its possible future applications. WebAssembly is an intermediate layer between various programming languages and many different execution environments. It can be used to run code in a browser, but it also has potential applications beyond the web. One of the most exciting applications of WebAssembly is its ability to execute code on the server-side, which allows for better performance and more efficient resource usage. This can be especially useful for applications that require real-time data processing and communication, such as online gaming. WebAssembly can also be used in the development of cross-platform applications because it can run on a variety of different platforms, including desktops, mobile devices, and even IoT devices. Another use case for WebAssembly is in the development of blockchain-based applications. WebAssembly is a more secure and efficient way to execute smart contracts on blockchains because it can execute code in a sandboxed environment, preventing malicious code from affecting the network. As more developers become familiar with WebAssembly and its capabilities, we can expect to see even more innovative applications in the future.

Researchers from Columbia University have established a method for growing human hair in a dish using 3D printing without the need for implantation into human skin. The method uses a combination of 3D printing and biotechnology to create hair follicles that can produce hair. This breakthrough could potentially revolutionize the hair transplant industry and provide an alternative to traditional hair restoration methods. The technique involves the creation of a "scaffold" that mimics the structure of hair follicles, which is then seeded with human dermal papilla cells and keratinocytes. The cells then grow and differentiate to create hair shafts, which can be harvested for transplantation or cosmetic use. The potential applications of this method also extend to developing new treatments for hair loss and related conditions.

Scientists from the University of Southern California were able to visualize memories forming in the brains of genetically modified zebrafish in the lab. The team expected the brains to form new neurons to encode new memories, but to their surprise, they found that existing neurons were actually being reorganized and rewired to form new memories. The researchers used advanced techniques that allowed them to monitor the activity of individual neurons in the zebrafish brains as they were learning a new task. This study provides valuable insight into how memories are formed and the plasticity of the brain. It could have implications for the treatment of memory-related disorders and potentially lead to new therapies that enhance memory formation or help restore lost memories.

The Facility for Rare Isotope Beams aims to create thousands of isotopes never before recorded on Earth. There are 285 isotopes of elements that exist on Earth, but there are thousands more that are predicted to exist based on theoretical models. The Facility for Rare Isotope Beams (FRIB), which is currently under construction at Michigan State University, aims to produce these rare and exotic isotopes using an advanced particle accelerator. FRIB will use a technique called fragmentation to create new isotopes. In this process, a high-energy beam of particles is fired at a target, shattering it into hundreds of pieces. Among these pieces will be some rare isotopes that have never been observed before. The rare isotopes will be separated from the rest of the debris using sophisticated equipment and then studied by researchers to better understand the properties of matter. FRIB is expected to be operational in 2022 and will be a valuable resource for researchers studying a wide range of topics, from nuclear physics to the origins of the universe.

Beartype is a pure-Python PEP-compliant constant-time runtime type checker. It brings static typing to Python while still preserving the permissive benefits of duck typing. Beartype can be used to assure that inputs to functions or methods conform to expected types and can also be used to check the return types from functions or methods. This can prevent many common errors that would otherwise only be caught at runtime, making your code more robust and easier to maintain. Additionally, Beartype can help with code readability by making the types of inputs and outputs more explicit. To use Beartype, you simply need to decorate your functions or methods with the beartype decorator and specify the expected types for each argument as well as the return type. Beartype will then perform type checking at runtime and raise an exception if the actual types do not match the expected types. Overall, Beartype is a powerful tool for improving the quality and reliability of your Python code, and it is definitely worth considering for any project that values type safety and maintainability.

England's Chester Zoo and a tissue bank called Nature's SAFE have partnered up to cryogenically freeze genetic material from animals that pass away at the zoo. The preserved material could be used in the future for conservation efforts, including breeding programs and restoring endangered species. Cryogenic freezing involves storing genetic material, such as sperm and egg samples or tissue samples, at extremely low temperatures 196C) to preserve their viability. This technology has been successfully used in conservation efforts for endangered species, allowing for genetic diversity to be maintained even if a species becomes extinct in the wild. The partnership between Chester Zoo and Nature's SAFE is an innovative step towards ensuring the long-term survival of endangered species. By preserving genetic material from animals at the zoo, even those that have passed away, scientists and conservationists can continue to work towards saving threatened species. The Perturb-seq map is the first comprehensive functional map of genes that are expressed in human cells. The data is available for any scientist to use. Ice cream develops a crunchy texture if left out of the freezer for too long due to overly large ice crystals. Scientists from the University of Tennessee have developed a new method to prevent large ice crystals from forming in ice cream. Instead of traditional cooling methods, the researchers used a process called micro-cooling, which involves rapidly cooling the ice cream at a very low temperature of -196 C. This technique allows the ice cream to freeze quickly, preventing large ice crystals from forming and improving the overall texture and taste of the ice cream. In addition to improving the texture of ice cream, this new method could also have applications in other frozen foods, such as frozen fruits and vegetables, and in the preservation of biological materials like blood and semen. Overall, this new technology has the potential to revolutionize the frozen food industry and improve the quality and shelf life of frozen foods.

This is a really detailed illustrated flowchart for learning to become an expert web developer in 2018, starting from "Learn HTML" and going all the way through complex topics like "React.js" and "Node.js." It covers all the essential tools and technologies that one needs to master in order to build efficient, responsive and scalable web applications. Here is a summary of the flowchart: 1. Start by learning the basics of HTML and CSS to build static web pages. 2. Master the principles of JavaScript, which is widely used for creating dynamic and interactive web applications. 3. Learn about CSS frameworks like Bootstrap or Materialize to make your website look more professional and user-friendly. 4. Dive into front-end libraries like jQuery for DOM manipulation and AJAX for fetching data from the server without refreshing the page. 5. Study modern front-end frameworks such as Angular or React.js, which are built on top of JavaScript and make it easier to manage complex User Interfaces (UI) 6. Explore some back-end technologies like PHP or Python, which provides server-side scripting for web applications. 7. Get familiar with MySQL or MongoDB, which are popular databases used in web development. 8. Learn about Node.js, a JavaScript runtime environment that allows you to build scalable, server-side applications in JavaScript. 9. Brush up on Security, Accessibility, and Best Practices for creating robust web applications. 10. Join online communities and contribute to open source projects to enhance your skills and knowledge. Remember that web development is a constantly evolving field, so you need to keep up-to-date with the latest changes and trends. Happy learning!

This article follows how a flaw was discovered and exploited in an internal test version of Google Cloud Deployment Manager. Google quickly responded to the report and fixed the issue. The article highlights the importance of thorough testing and vulnerability detection in cloud-based systems, and the need for transparency and speedy remediation when security flaws are discovered. A new privacy feature in Firefox strips custom URL query parameters from URLs to prevent tracking. The Query Parameter Stripping feature automatically strips various query parameters from clicked links and visited URLs, which are often used by advertisers and analytics services to track users across the web. This can help protect users' privacy and prevent the collection of their personal information without their explicit consent. To enable this feature in Firefox, go to Preferences Privacy Security Address Bar, and check the box next to "Delete clicked link query parameters." Note that this feature may break some websites' functionality, so use it with caution and consider disabling it if you encounter issues.

The seahorse placenta is a fascinating example of convergent evolution. Male seahorses' brood pouches develop and function like human placentas. During pregnancy, the males provide embryos with everything they need. Yes, that's right! The seahorse is one of the few animals in which the males are responsible for caring for the developing embryos. The brood pouch provides protection, oxygen, and nutrients to the growing embryos, much like a human placenta does. This is an excellent example of convergent evolution, where two different species evolve similar adaptations to solve the same problem. In this case, both seahorses and humans evolved placenta-like structures to support their growing embryos.

Mark Zuckerberg has highlighted four areas (data portability, election integrity, harmful content, and privacy) which he believes require regulation, in an op-ed published on March 30. He stated that a s a company, Facebook is willing to work with governments and regulators to address these issues and develop industry-wide standards. Zuckerberg called for clearer guidelines around data portability, which would allow users to move their data between different platforms. He also emphasized the need for consistent rules around elections to ensure the integrity of democratic processes. In terms of harmful content, Zuckerberg acknowledged that internet companies have a responsibility to address and remove content that could cause violence or harm. He called for more transparency around content moderation practices and greater collaboration between governments, industry, and civil society. Regarding privacy, Zuckerberg called for a globally harmonized framework to establish clear rules around how personal data should be handled and protected. Overall, Zuckerberg's op-ed represents a significant shift in Facebook's stance towards regulation. In the past, the company has been criticized for resisting regulation and being slow to address issues around data privacy and content moderation.

Alexa will now be able to proactively act on Hunches thanks to its latest update. WeWork has closed down around 2,300 phone booths at some of its sites in the US and Canada after it discovered elevated levels of formaldehyde. The discovery was made after employees reported experiencing eye irritation and other symptoms. WeWork hired an outside consultant to test the phone booths and found that they contained concentrations of formaldehyde above the US Occupational Safety and Health Administration's permissible exposure limits. Formaldehyde is a colourless gas with a strong odour that is commonly used in building materials such as plywood and particleboard. In high concentrations, it can cause irritation of the eyes, nose, and throat, as well as respiratory problems and other health issues. WeWork is now reportedly undertaking a review of all of its phone booths globally to ensure they comply with safety standards.

Optogenetics is a method of controlling neurons with light. A team of researchers from Northwestern University built an ultraminiature, wireless, battery-free, and fully implantable optogenetics device for mice that allowed them to control neuronal activity using light while the mice were free to move around without any wires or external power sources. The device was able to stimulate neuronal activity in a specific area of the brain using blue light, which was delivered via a light-emitting diode (LED). The device also incorporated temperature and pressure sensors to monitor the surrounding tissue and prevent any tissue damage. The researchers believe this technology could eventually be adapted for human use to treat various neurological conditions.

Amazon is developing a technology that will allow customers to connect their credit card information to their hands, allowing them to purchase items with their palms. The company has been testing this technology, called Amazon One, in select Amazon Go stores in Seattle since 2020. With Amazon One, a customer would simply wave their hand over a scanner to pay for goods instead of having to use a credit card or cash. This technology uses a combination of computer vision algorithms and sensors to create a unique palm signature for each customer. This signature is securely stored and can be used to verify the customer's identity when making purchases. One of the benefits of Amazon One is that it could potentially reduce the need for physical contact when paying for goods, which could be particularly useful during the COVID-19 pandemic. However, some people have raised concerns about the use of biometric data, particularly if it is hacked or stolen. Amazon has stated that it takes privacy and security seriously and that the palm signature data is encrypted and kept secure. Customers can also delete their palm signature if they no longer want to use Amazon One. At this time, it remains to be seen if Amazon One will be rolled out to more stores or if it will become a widespread payment method. Nevertheless, it is an intriguing example of how technology is changing the way we pay for goods and services.

In his departure statement, Gates said, "I am looking forward to this next phase as an opportunity to maintain the friendships and partnerships that have meant so much to me, continue to contribute to two companies of which I am incredibly proud, and effectively prioritize my commitment to addressing some of the world's toughest challenges."

Physicists predict that information can be transmitted across two black holes paired via quantum entanglement. If the theory is correct, it might offer clues on how to unite quantum mechanics and general relativity, the two pillars of modern physics, into a single framework known as quantum gravity. This would represent a major breakthrough in our understanding of the universe, as it could help us explain phenomena at both the largest and smallest scales. The idea behind transmitting information through entangled black holes is that, by manipulating one of the black holes, we could affect the other one instantaneously, regardless of the distance that separates them. This violates the laws of classical physics, but is allowed by quantum mechanics, which allows for particles to be linked in a way that goes beyond our everyday experience of the world. If scientists can demonstrate that information can indeed be transmitted in this way, it would provide strong evidence for the existence of quantum gravity, which remains a theoretical concept that has yet to be proven experimentally. It could also lead to the development of new technologies, such as quantum computers and communication systems, that would be more powerful and secure than anything we have today.

Gitmoji allows you to use emojis on git commit messages to provide an easy way to identify the purpose or intention of a commit. A guide on how to use Gitmoji is as follows: 1. Install the Gitmoji CLI by running the following command in your terminal: 'npm i -g gitmoji-cli' 2. Initialize Git emoji in your project by running: 'gitmoji -i' 3. Start using Gitmoji in your commit messages. Instead of writing a traditional commit message like: " ' git commit -m "Added new feature" " ' you can use Gitmoji to make the commit message more expressive and descriptive. For example: " ' git commit -m " Added new feature" " ' The is the Gitmoji for feature addition. 4. Here are some commonly used Gitmoji: - - Initial commit - - Bug fix - - New feature - - Code refactoring - - Removing codefiles - - Performance improvement - - Documentation update - - Deployment Using Gitmoji can help you and your team to quickly understand the purpose or intention of a commit. It also adds a fun and interesting touch to your commit messages!

Identify the root cause of an incident with a single search. Incident response is stressful and overwhelming, but it doesn't need to be. Identify the root cause of an incident, To identify the root cause of an incident, you can start by conducting a root cause analysis (RCA). This involves investigating the incident thoroughly, identifying all contributing factors, and determining the fundamental reason the incident occurred. You can use various techniques, such as the "five whys" method or a fishbone diagram, to help you identify the root cause. It might also require analyzing data and logs, reviewing procedures and policies, and interviewing key personnel involved in the incident. Once the root cause is identified, you can develop a plan to address it and prevent similar incidents from occurring in the future.

The Exploration Extravehicular Mobility Unit (xEMU) is a new type of spacesuit designed for protecting astronauts from the harsh environment of the lunar surface. The xEMU features several improvements over previous spacesuits, including a more flexible torso for easier movement and advanced dust mitigation systems to prevent lunar dust from contaminating the suit and equipment. It also has an improved communication system and better cooling capabilities to help astronauts stay comfortable during their missions. In addition to the xEMU, NASA is also developing a suit for use in the Gateway, a lunar outpost that will serve as a jumping-off point for future missions to the Moon and beyond. The Gateway EVA suit is designed for longer-duration missions and will include features such as a radiation protection system and a more advanced mobility system. Overall, the xEMU and Gateway EVA suit represent significant advancements in spacesuit technology that will help humans explore and conduct science on the lunar surface more efficiently and safely.

Quantum chess is a version of regular chess that incorporates the quantum concepts of superposition, entanglement, and interference. The game teaches players to develop an intuitive sense of the rules and principles of quantum mechanics while still retaining the classic gameplay of chess. In quantum chess, pieces can exist in multiple positions simultaneously, and moves can create entangled states that affect other pieces on the board. The game is still played on an 8x8 board with the same set of pieces, but the possibilities and strategies are expanded by the addition of these quantum elements. It's a fascinating way to learn and apply quantum principles in a fun and engaging way. Would you like to know more about it?

A CSS pseudo-element is a keyword added to a selector that lets you style a specific part of a selected element. This post discusses five pseudo-elements in order to help you understand how to use them in your CSS stylesheets: 1.::before - This pseudo-element allows you to insert content before the content of a selected element. You can specify the content to be inserted as well as its positioning and styling. 2.::after - Similar to::before, this pseudo-element allows you to insert content after the content of a selected element. You can also specify its content, positioning, and styling. 3.::first-letter - With this pseudo-element, you can style the first letter of the text content inside a selected element. This can be useful for formatting titles or drop-caps. 4.::first-line - This pseudo-element allows you to style the first line of the text content inside a selected element. You can adjust the font size, line height, and other text properties. 5.::selection - When a user selects text on a web page, the selected text is highlighted using the style defined by the::selection pseudo-element. You can use this pseudo-element to adjust the background color, text color, and other visual properties of selected text. By using these pseudo-elements, you can create unique and visually dynamic web pages that stand out from the rest.

Blocks have shown up in almost every blogging tool, web editor, note-taking app, and content management system, but they are almost all proprietary and non-standard. Blocks are often limited to specific platforms or tools, making it difficult to use them effectively across different applications. However, there is a growing movement towards adopting a standardized and open source approach to blocks, which would allow for greater interoperability and flexibility. One example of this is the Gutenberg editor used in WordPress, which is designed around a block-based approach to content creation. The blocks in Gutenberg can be easily customized and extended, making it possible to create highly customized and dynamic content. Another initiative is the Universal Content Blocks project, which aims to create a set of standardized block components that can be used across different web platforms and content management systems. This would make it easier for developers to create block-based content that can be used in different contexts and applications. Overall, the adoption of a standardized and open approach to blocks would enable more flexible and efficient content creation, editing, and sharing across different platforms and tools.

Jerdon's jumping worker ants can become reproductive queens when their queens die. The transition comes with changes to the ant's brain, gene expression, hormone levels, and cell composition. These findings shed light on the complex biological processes that underlie the social organization and reproduction in ant colonies.

At the beginning of the year, OpenAI released the model-weights and code for CLIP, a model trained to determine which caption from a set of captions best fits a given image. CLIP stands for Contrastive Language-Image Pre-Training and was trained on a massive dataset of images and their associated captions. It works by embedding both the image and caption into a joint space, where the distance between the two embeddings determines the relevance of the caption to the image. One of the main applications of CLIP is for image search and retrieval. It can be used to categorize and search through large databases of images based on their associated captions or tags. Additionally, CLIP has been used for generating image descriptions and for visual question-answering tasks. Overall, CLIP is a powerful model for understanding the relationship between text and images and has a wide range of potential applications in the field of computer vision.

This is a newsletter about CSS layouts (flexboxes, grids, modals, and all that good stuff). If you often find yourself googling stuff like "vertical align not working," you might want to keep reading. CSS layouts can be tricky, but mastering them is essential for creating modern, responsive websites. Here are a few tips to help you out: 1. Use Flexbox for simple layouts: Flexbox is a powerful CSS layout system that allows you to create flexible, responsive layouts with just a few lines of code. It's great for simple layouts where you need to align items vertically or horizontally. 2. Use Grid for complex layouts: Grid is another CSS layout system that's great for complex layouts with multiple rows and columns. It allows you to create responsive layouts that adapt to different screen sizes, and is perfect for creating magazine-style designs. 3. Avoid floats: Floats used to be the go-to method for creating layouts, but they can be unpredictable and hard to work with. Flexbox and Grid are much more powerful and reliable, and should be used instead. 4. Try out CSS Grid Garden: If you're new to Grid, try out the fun and educational game CSS Grid Garden. It'll teach you the basics of Grid in a playful and engaging way. 5. Use modals sparingly: Modals are great for displaying information or forms that the user needs to interact with, but they can be overused. Try to use them only when necessary, and consider alternatives like showing and hiding elements instead. By mastering CSS layouts, you'll be able to create beautiful, responsive designs that work across all devices. Good luck!

Two centuries ago, it was established that the average human body temperature was 98.6 degrees Fahrenheit, or 37 degrees Celsius. Scientists have noticed a drop in average body temperature in recent years, with some studies showing that the average body temperature is now closer to 97.5 degrees Fahrenheit, or 36.4 degrees Celsius. There are several factors attributed to this change, including changes in human physiology, lifestyle and environment, and improvements in healthcare and sanitation. The increase in obesity rates, for example, may contribute to lower average body temperatures, as excess body weight can cause a decrease in metabolic activity. Additionally, advancements in healthcare and sanitation have led to a reduction in the frequency and severity of infections, which can cause a temporary increase in body temperature. Despite the decreasing average body temperature, it is still important that individuals monitor their own body temperature and seek medical attention if they experience abnormal temperature fluctuations.

Solar panels emit infrared radiation at night. The photons going out into the night sky cool down the solar cell. This temperature difference can be used to generate electricity using what is known as a thermoelectric generator. This technology uses the temperature difference between two materials to create an electrical voltage. In the case of solar panels, the difference in temperature between the solar cell and the surrounding air can be harnessed to create electricity. However, this technology is still in the experimental stage and has not been commercially implemented yet. Also, the amount of electricity generated may not be sufficient to power homes or other devices.

PostgreSQL 14 has a new multirange feature that makes range types in PostgreSQL more powerful. Range types allow developers to store various kinds of intervals with upper and lower bounds. That's correct! PostgreSQL 14 introduced a new multirange data type that can be used to store multiple ranges in a single column. This feature can be particularly useful in scenarios where you need to store multiple ranges of values, such as when working with time intervals or geographical data. With multiranges, you can create a column that can store multiple range values without resorting to complex table structures or additional columns. You can also perform range-based queries on multiranges, such as finding entries within a particular range or checking if a range intersects with another range. To create a multirange column, you can use the 'multirange' data type along with the range subtype you want to use. For example, if you want to store date ranges, you can use the 'daterange' subtype along with 'multirange', like so: " ' CREATE TABLE events (id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY, name TEXT NOT NULL, dateranges daterange; " ' Then, you can insert data into this column using multirange literals, such as: " ' INSERT INTO events (name, dateranges) VALUES Event A', 2022-01-01, 2022-01-03) ," 2022-01-07, 2022-01-09) ; " ' Overall, multirange data types in PostgreSQL 14 can simplify data storage and querying for scenarios where you need to work with multiple ranges.

This technology has the potential to revolutionize the field of orthopedic surgery and provide patients with safer, more effective solutions for a range of skeletal injuries and conditions.

Dwarf Fortress is a simulation game where players play in a deeply detailed randomly generated fantasy world. It was programmed by one developer, Tarn Adams, who has been working on the game since 2002 with occasional help from his brother, Zach Adams. In Dwarf Fortress, players take on the role of managing a colony of dwarves, helping them to build structures, gather resources, and defend themselves against various threats. The game has an incredibly deep and intricate simulation system, taking into account things like temperature, moisture, individual dwarf personalities, and even the flow of liquids and gases. It also has a notoriously steep learning curve, with a complex interface and many different systems to understand. Despite this complexity, Dwarf Fortress has gained a passionate following among players who appreciate its deep and emergent gameplay. The game is free to play, but players can choose to donate to the developers as a way of supporting ongoing development.

CRISPRoff is a new gene-editing technology that can control gene expression while leaving the sequence of the DNA unchanged. Using CRISPRoff, scientists can silence the vast majority of genes without modifying their DNA sequence. This technology allows researchers to turn genes on or off, leading to potential applications in a variety of fields, from medicine to agriculture. For example, it could be used to develop therapies for genetic diseases or to improve crop yields by regulating genes associated with plant growth or resistance to pests. One of the advantages of CRISPRoff over other gene-editing techniques is its reversibility. Because the DNA sequence itself is not changed, it is possible to turn gene expression back on if needed. Additionally, because CRISPRoff is a non-destructive method, it could be used in cells or tissues that cannot be easily replaced, such as neurons in the brain. However, like all new technologies, there are some concerns around the potential ethical implications of CRISPRoff. For example, some worry that it could be used to engineer so-called "designer babies" or enhance human traits. As with any powerful tool, it will be important to use CRISPRoff responsibly and with careful consideration of its potential impacts.

This article is an introduction to learning COmmon Business Oriented Language (COBOL). COBOL is a domain-specific language for business. It excels in managing and manipulating heterogeneous data in record structures, such as files or databases. COBOL has been around since the late 1950s and was developed specifically for business applications. It was designed to be easily readable and understood by non-technical users, and it has been widely used in the financial, government, and healthcare industries. COBOL is a procedural programming language, meaning that it focuses on the steps needed to solve a specific problem. It uses a series of statements that are executed sequentially, with the ability to branch to other parts of the program as needed. One of the strengths of COBOL is its ability to work with large amounts of data. It features a robust set of data manipulation tools that allow for efficient storage, retrieval, and analysis of complex data structures. This makes it well-suited for handling large-scale business processes that involve processing huge amounts of information. Despite its decades-long history, COBOL remains in use today. Many legacy systems still rely on this language, and there is a continued demand for developers that can work with COBOL code. In recent years, there has been a push to modernize and update COBOL applications, ensuring that this language remains a key part of business computing for years to come. If you are interested in learning COBOL, there are many resources available online, including tutorials, videos, and documentation. Additionally, many universities offer courses in COBOL programming as part of their computer science or information technology programs. With its continued relevance in the business world, learning COBOL can be a valuable skill for anyone interested in a career in software development or computer programming.

HTTPX is a next-generation HTTP client for Python which aims to provide more functionality than the requests module. In addition to the standard features of requests, HTTPX has sessions with connection pooling, async support, response decoding, request retries, and more. It also supports HTTP2, HTTP1.1, and WebSockets. HTTPX is considered more performant and memory-efficient than the requests module due to its use of async IO and the asyncio library. It's also more flexible, allowing for custom headers, authentication methods, and proxies. Overall, if you're working on a project that requires high-performance HTTP requests with additional functionality beyond what requests provides, HTTPX is a great choice.

Uber and Lyft must classify their drivers as employees unless their emergency appeal to block the ruling is successful. It is a major change for the ride-hailing industry, which has long relied on the independent contractor model. Many drivers and labor advocates have argued that the current classification leaves drivers without basic protections and benefits, while the companies have argued that it would fundamentally change their business model and lead to higher prices for riders. The companies have launched an appeal, but if they are unsuccessful, they will have to reclassify their drivers in California, where the ruling was made, and could potentially face similar legal challenges in other states.

Singapore currently produces about 10 percent of its food. Due to climate change and population growth, it aims to produce 30 percent of its food by 2030. In order to achieve this goal, the Singaporean government has implemented several initiatives to boost local food production. Some of these initiatives include: 1. Vertical farming: Singapore is promoting the use of vertical farming to maximise the use of limited land resources. Vertical farms take up less space while yielding more crops per unit of land compared to traditional farming methods. 2. Rooftop farming: Rooftop farming is a new trend that is gaining popularity in cities around the world, and Singapore is no exception. Rooftop farms are built on top of buildings, using previously unused space to grow crops. 3. Indoor farming: With the use of hydroponics and LED lighting, indoor farming can grow crops year-round, regardless of weather conditions, and with significantly less water than traditional farming methods. 4. Aquaponics: Aquaponics is a combination of aquaculture (the farming of fish) and hydroponics (growing plants in water). The waste produced by fish is used to fertilise plants, while the plants help to clean the water for the fish. This method requires less water than traditional farming methods. 5. Education and support: The government is also putting in efforts to educate and support individuals and organisations who want to participate in local food production. This includes providing grants, training and technical support. All of these initiatives show Singapore's commitment to increasing its food production capabilities and becoming more self-sufficient.

Barcelona-based startup Kreios Space plans to send satellites on very low Earth orbit (VLEO) missions. VLEO is a zone between 95 to 250 miles of altitude. CSS was never designed to be a server-side language, but that doesn't mean that it can't be used as one. This article walks through how to use CSS as a server-side language using tools like Sass and Node.js. Sass is a CSS preprocessor that extends CSS to include variables, functions, and nested rules. It can be used to write more organized and efficient CSS code, and it can also be compiled server-side using tools like Node.js. Here's how to use Sass and Node.js to compile CSS server-side: 1. Install Sass: You can install Sass globally using npm (Node Package Manager) by running the following command in your terminal: " ' npm install -g sass " ' 2. Create a Sass file: Create a .scss file with your Sass code. For this example, let's create a file called "styles.scss" with the following code: " ' primary-color: 3498db; body { background-color: primary-color; } " ' This file defines a variable called "primary-color" and sets the background color of the body element to that variable. 3. Compile Sass to CSS: Run the following command in your terminal to compile the "styles.scss" file to a regular CSS file called "styles.css": " ' sass styles.scss styles.css " ' This command will create a new file called "styles.css" with the compiled CSS code. 4. Use the compiled CSS: You can link to the compiled CSS file in your HTML just like any other CSS file: " ' link rel"stylesheet" href"styles.css" " ' By running the Sass compiler server-side using Node.js, you can automate the process of compiling Sass to CSS and serve the compiled CSS to your clients. This can be helpful for large-scale web projects where managing CSS files can become difficult.
